definition: brush stroke in Chinese painting and calligraphy/brushwork/style of drawing or writing
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions

sentences.english: She paints with bold strokes of the brush.
sentences.chinese: 她用雄健有力的笔触绘画。

sentences.english: With touching pathos he described the pangs of hunger.
sentences.chinese: 他以极具感伤力的笔触描述了饥饿的痛苦。

sentences.english: It has a soft brushed finish, and is a gunmetal blue color.
sentences.chinese: 它有一个软笔触完成，是一种体形蓝色。

sentences.english: The piece consists of white brushstrokes as abstract representations of snowflakes.
sentences.chinese: 在这幅画作中，画家用白色的笔触抽象地表现雪花。

sentences.english: His motif emerges from various kinds of his nervous brush-stroke, from chaos.
sentences.chinese: 他的动机来自于他种种强健的笔触和混乱。

sentences.english: Would your strokes be tremblingly timid or brilliantly bold?
sentences.chinese: 你的笔触会是怯懦的还是大胆的？

sentences.english: Feng Feng's brush strokes are also full of the accent of randomness in calligraphy.
sentences.chinese: 冯峰的画面笔触，同样充满书写的随意性。

sentences.english: The brush on rice paper is a code, just as digital technology is.
sentences.chinese: 宣纸上的笔触是一种代码，正如同数码技术一样。

sentences.english: Such a fish should undoubtedly belong to China because its hear is made of brushing stroke.
sentences.chinese: 毛笔的笔触构成的大头鱼，当然是中国的。

sentences.english: She describes her mind and life quite movingly.
sentences.chinese: 她以颇为动人的笔触形容了自己的思想和生命。

sentences.english: At a more granular level, the smaller brush strokes have a similar effect.
sentences.chinese: 细处来看，更小的画笔笔触也有相似的效果。

sentences.english: A limited edition giclee print on canvas, hand embellished including brush strokes.
sentences.chinese: 限量版画册专辑在画布上，手饰包括笔触。

sentences.english: On the road, I opened my book and accumulated my strokes page by page.
sentences.chinese: 在旅途中，翻开书册，逐页累积笔触。

definition: to trace over/to take a copy (of a calligraphy, a painting etc)/(fig.) to describe/to portray
line drawing in traditional ink and brush style/simple and straightforward style of writing
to touch up (a piece of writing)/to add details (to a painting)
the tip of a writing brush/vigor of style in writing/stroke/touch
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
the wording and purport of what one writes
